intro: Psychotria brevistipulata, commonly known as the "Coca leaf plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. The plant has been traditionally used by indigenous communities for its stimulant properties, particularly in the preparation of coca tea.
